description: From Middle English cheveteyn, cheftayne, from Old French chevetaine, from Late Latin capitaneus (English captain), from Latin caput (“head”), from Proto-Indo-European *kauput- (English head). Doublet of captain.

entries.meaning: A leader of a clan or tribe.
(by extension) A leader of a group.
examples: The robber chieftain divided up the spoils.
